title: Château Laforge 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. Concentrated flavors of chocolate and coffee are joined by smooth, dense blackberries, spice and delicious perfumes. This is a generous wine with fine tannins which will allow it to age. Drink from 2021.

title: Château le Prieuré 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. Fine tannins and ripe fruit are strong elements in this complex wine. With a solid, dense texture, juicy acidity and a dark core of tannins, it is a wine that will age, so hold until 2023.

title: Château Quinault L'Enclos 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This soft, ripe wine has generous black-fruit flavors and fine acidity. The palate is juicy, with dense fruit and chocolate tones framed by light tannins. There is a crisp, fresh finish, which gives the wine a fine lift.

title: Château d'Arche 2017 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. Opulent and rich, this densely textured wine is full in weight, with honey, sweet spice, rich peach and mango flavors. It is a fine wine, not for long-term aging and ready to drink from 2021.

title: Château de Malle 2017 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. Rich while also intensely structured, this wine is already showing a delicious, open character. The acidity shines through the wine's sweetness, giving lift to the decadent spiced fruit tones. Drink from 2023.

title: Château Paloumey 2017 Barrel Sample  (Haut-Médoc)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This wine reflects the vintage very well. It has forward ripe fruits, juicy acidity and a touch of smoky wood. It will develop well; drink from 2022.

title: Château Mouton Rothschild 2017 Aile d'Argent Barrel Sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. With a lovely citrus character and a touch of melon, this is a delicious wine. It is fresh, just hinting at tropical fruit. With its tangy edge, it will be delicious from the end of 2018.

title: Château Pape Clément 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This is a hugely dense, extracted wine, possibly too much so, displaying a hard edge that smothers the ripe fruit. Giving it the benefit of the doubt, it certainly will not be drinkable before 2024.

title: Château Lascombes 2017 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This is a fruity wine, with attractive cassis flavor and some crisp acidity. It has plenty of fresh fruit and acidity that lead into a bright finish. It is not a powerful wine, but it will be easy to drink from 2023.

title: Château Pichon Longueville 2017 Barrel Sample Les Tourelles de Longueville  (Pauillac)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This wine is soft, fruity and generous in texture. It has spice, a rounded structure and layers of gentle tannins. Dark in color, the fruit is bright and warm. The wine will develop quickly and will be ready to drink from 2021.
designation: Barrel Sample Les Tourelles de Longueville

title: Château le Thil 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. Ripe Merlot dominates this full, rich wine. Softly textured, the wine has a rounded character that is lifted by bright acidity and rich black fruits. It is generous yet lightly structured. This is a style of wine that will age quickly, so drink from 2022.

title: A.A. Badenhorst Family Wines 2015 Ramnasgras Cinsault (Swartland)
description: Notes of rosehip, clove, nutmeg, red currant, rhubarb and wild strawberry all abound on the nose and mouth in this fresh, vibrant wine. Fine tannins lend a soft structure to the medium-weight palate, with bright acidity providing freshness and levity. Hints of Dr. Pepper and tart red currant ride out the mouthwatering close. Drink now–2021.

title: Amalie Robert 2013 Dijon Clones Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Seven clones contribute to this blend, an aromatic and elegant wine with wild berries, a touch of rhubarb, and some peppery green highlights. It's light but not at all thin, nor does it short the finish. In fact, it's deceptively long, and that is its real strength.

title: Anam Cara 2015 Mark IX Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: This is three-quarters Pommard, the rest a field blend from low-yielding reserve-quality vines, and treated to 50% new French oak. Lightly peppery and herbal, its berry fruit comes with suggestions of chicken stock and a dash of sea salt. Not quite as concentrated as previous vintages, but balanced and drinking nicely.

title: Domaine Pfister 2016 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: A touch of Mirabelle plum joins a fresh Conference pear note on the nose. The same fresh, clean flavors are abundant on the refreshing palate, which is toned, dry and has lovely concentration and poise.

title: Dr. Loosen 2016 Blue Slate Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)
description: Juicy white grapefruit and lime notes are accented by hints of smoke, spice and crushed earth in this easy drinking yet exhilarating kabinett. It's light footed and approachably fruity yet lingers on a refreshing mineral finish.

title: Dr. Pauly Bergweiler 2016 Bernkasteler alte Badstube am Doctorberg Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)
description: While initially closed and earthy, time and aeration coax prettier notes of blossom, melon and peach. It's still a deeply mineral spätlese, full of crushed stone and earth, but also a bounty of ripe stone fruit and tangerine. The finish is moderately long, ending on a slightly astringent crushed-vitamin note.
designation: Bernkasteler alte Badstube am Doctorberg Spätlese

title: Efeste 2014 Upright Klipsun Vineyards Merlot (Red Mountain)
description: Aromas of dried herb, dark cherry, black raspberry and barrel spice are at the fore on this 100% varietal wine. They lead to sleek cherry and cranberry flavors that provide intrigue.

title: Eikendal 2015 Chardonnay (Western Cape)
description: Somewhat shy and reserved at first, with time this comes around to reveal pleasantly nuanced notes of white peach, pear and pineapple core, as well as hints of white florals. There's a vibrant verve to the palate, with nervy notes of green plum and lime rind that carry through to the clean, mouthwatering finish. Drink now–2020.

title: Etude 2015 Grace Benoist Ranch Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This likable white is made in a light vibrant style, utilizing only neutral oak. Apricot fuzz and mellow toast ride along a thick acid-driven road of green apple skin, melon and fig.

title: Gallo Signature Series 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a 100% varietal wine from William Hill Estate grapes. It is a softly textured effort that offers the perfect amount of underlying tannic grip. Cinnamon, red currant and plum flavors complement cured meat, black olive, soy and black licorice.

title: Holloran 2014 Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: The winery's Dundee Hills bottling mixes fruit from three vineyards, two dating back to the 1970s. Black-cherry fruit fills out with nuances of black olive, black tea and roasted coffee. Everything is handled with balance and clarity, and the finishing tannins are light and supple.

title: Hugel 2014 Classic Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: High-toned, vivid notes of red, tart cherry rise from the glass. The palate adds more dimension and richness to the fruit, but this remains slender and wonderfully tart throughout. The tannins are fine but could do with a little more focus. Nonetheless, a rustic charm plays about this.

title: Icario 2011  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano
description: Forest floor, truffle, leather, spiced blueberry and scorched-earth aromas all take shape in the glass. Round and juicy, the chewy palate doles out fleshy black cherry, blackberry and licorice alongside polished, seasoned tannins. Drink through 2021.

title: Iris Vineyards 2016 Steelhead Run Vineyard Syrah (Applegate Valley)
description: The Applegate Valley is looking more and more like the perfect spot for Syrah in southern Oregon. Here are pretty mulberry and blueberry fruit flavors, with medium concentration and snappy tangy acids. The flavors are persistent and balanced, and hints of bacon and cured meats put a varietal signature on the finish.

title: J. Christopher 2015 Sandra Adele Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: The aim here, according to the winery, is to show both floral and earthy components. The floral, sweetly fruity aspect is front and center, and you can find lighter, more subtle suggestions of earth and dried leaves as well. It's a working blend, and a wine best consumed over the next five years.

title: Jerusalem Wineries 2014 4990 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Judean Hills)
description: This wine offers a bouquet of cherry, raspberry and coffee bean. Flavors of black cherry, raspberry and coffee bean wrapped in subtle tannins are followed by a vein of eucalyptus that continues into the cool, minty finish.

title: Judge Palmer 2014 Blau Vineyard Malbec (Knights Valley)
description: Plummy blueberry, black cherry and black currant wrap around a softly layered core of toasted oak in this light and delicate take on the oft-hearty variety. Smatterings of vanilla and dark chocolate tease on the finish.

title: King Estate 2016 Chardonnay (Oregon)
description: Forward and nicely structured, with lime, grapefruit and green-apple flavors, this strikes a perfect balance from start to finish. It's clean, true to variety and annotated with suggestions of wet stone. A great choice for your every-day Chardonnay.

title: Kuentz-Bas 2016 White (Alsace)
description: The merest touch of honeysuckle plays on the fresh apple nose. The slender palate offers lemon freshness and a pithy texture. The finish is clean and combines ripe pear with vivid lemon.
